title: Odd.
content:
And my 3.5 GB download is still in progress:
[img]http://i144.photobucket.com/albums/r176/shadowm2006/sickdude_again.png[/img]

Notice it's -314% completed.------------------------------

title: Re: Odd.
content:
That IS a weird error. Especially considering it's not related to any computer limits (like 256 and 512). Little easter egg when it can't get the correct percentage, perhaps?

Nah... unlikely.____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].

title: Re: Odd.
content:
It's not technically an error, as the download continues fine, and data is actually being written to the disk. It's a 4 GB download anyway. I guess this is what happens when you run a UNIX-oriented tool (wget) on Windows Vista. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-embarrassed.gif[/img] But better that than using some spyware-loaded download managers, isn't it?------------------------------

title: Re: Odd.
content:
When I say error, I sometimes mean "bug", "warning" or "exception". [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] ____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

title: Re: Odd.
content:
Oh, sorry. We, programmers, tend to use the word error exclusively for refering to exceptions.------------------------------

title: Re: Odd.
content:
Heh, first time I've seen negative percent of something. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Odd.
content:
"We programmers"
Oh, thanks for implying I am not one.

Seeing a negative number would make you think a signed variable went over its limits, but considering the limit is always 100 for percentages it's a bit weird____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].

title: Re: Odd.
content:
You'll probably find the size of the download was a number > 31 bits, so when the calculation was performed, instead of something like 1570/2000*100 = 78.5% the "2000" wraps around and you get something silly like 1570/-500*100 = -314%

Still, quite a fluke it came up with that particular number - if you'd left it too much longer the number wouldn't have been anywhere near as entertaining [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] [url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Odd.
content:
It indicated -100% complete around the first 150 MB of the download. Then, it continued to decrease by 1. I took that screenshot, somehow, in the exact moment it was indicating -314% complete. Quite a coincidence, perhaps it's a sign of our future? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-potter.gif[/img] ------------------------------
